ruleset.name: Apex Documentation Rules
ruleset.description: Custom rules for Apex documentation standards

rule.name: MethodsRequireExampleTag
rule.message: Methods must have at least one @example tag in their ApexDoc comments, unless they have annotations, are overrides, or are interface methods
rule.description:
Methods must have at least one @example tag in their ApexDoc comments containing a {@code} block to provide usage examples. This helps developers understand how to use the method correctly.
According to the Salesforce ApexDoc format specification, @example tags must contain {@code} blocks to properly format code examples.
Exceptions: Methods are exempt from this requirement if they: - Have any annotation (e.g., @IsTest, @InvocableMethod, @AuraEnabled) - Are override methods (marked with @Override) - Are interface method declarations (methods defined in interfaces)
Version: 1.0.0

property.name: xpath
property.value: //Method[ ( FormalComment[starts-with(@Image, '/**') and ( not(contains(@Image, '@example')) or (contains(@Image, '@example') and not(contains(@Image, '{@code}'))) )] or preceding-sibling::FormalComment[starts-with(@Image, '/**') and ( not(contains(@Image, '@example')) or (contains(@Image, '@example') and not(contains(@Image, '{@code}'))) )] ) and not(ModifierNode/Annotation) and not(ModifierNode[@Override = true()]) and not(ancestor::UserClass[@Interface = 'true']) ]
